extendedIngredients.name: ahi tuna steaks
extendedIngredients.original: 4 6- to 8-ozahi tuna steaks (each about 3/4 to 1 inch thick)
extendedIngredients.originalName: ahi tuna steaks (each about 3/4 to 1 inch thick)

extendedIngredients.name: dried great northern beans
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup dried Great Northern beans (about 6 1/2 ozs)

extendedIngredients.name: fresh thyme
extendedIngredients.original: 5 tsps chopped fresh thyme or 2 tsps dried
extendedIngredients.originalName: chopped fresh thyme or 2 tsps dried

extendedIngredients.name: low-salt chicken broth

extendedIngredients.originalName: chicken stock or canned low-salt chicken broth

title: Tuna With White Beans And Sun-dried Tomato Sauce
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Tuna With White Beans And Sun-dried Tomato Sauce a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 56g of protein, 35g of fat, and a total of 687 calories. This recipe serves 4. For $7.66 per serving, this recipe covers 48% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. A mixture of low-salt chicken broth, carrot, thyme, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. To use up the lemon peel you could follow this main course with the Lemon Syrup Cake with Berries and Lemon-Curd Cream as a dessert. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and dairy free diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour and 24 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 89%. This score is tremendous. Try Tuna with White Beans and Sun-Dried Tomato Sauce, Artichoke and Sun Dried Tomato Pasta, and Easy Vegan Sun Dried Tomato Pesto for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Tuna can be paired with Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. The Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 40 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Nickel & Nickel Harris Vineyard Merlot
productMatches.description: Bright red fruits, candied blueberry, Santa Rosa plum and menthol aromas all blend together to intoxicate the nose as the 2016 Harris Vineyard Merlot wafts from the glass. On the palate, a juicy and fruity entry is supported by chewy tannins and a balancing acidity, creating lush layers that coat the tongue and produce a soft, elegant finish.

instructions: Preparation                                        Place beans in medium bowl. Add enough cold water to cover beans by 3 inches. Let stand overnight. Drain.                                                                            Combine beans and stock in large saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium; cover and simmer until beans are just tender, about 1 hour. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid.                                                                            Heat 3 tablespoons oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, carrot and celery and saut until almost tender, about 5 minutes. Add thyme and lemon peel and stir 1 minute. Add beans, reserved 1/2 cup cooking liquid and 2 tablespoons oil and toss until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Cover to keep warm.                                                                            Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in another heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle tuna with salt and pepper. Add tuna to skillet and cook to desired doneness, about 3 minutes per side for medium.                                                                            Spoon beans onto center of each of 4 plates, dividing equally among plates. Top each with tuna steak. Spoon Sun-dried Tomato Sauce over tuna steaks and serve immediately.

steps.step: Add enough cold water to cover beans by 3 inches.
Combine beans and stock in large saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium; cover and simmer until beans are just tender, about 1 hour.
Heat 3 tablespoons oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion, carrot and celery and saut until almost tender, about 5 minutes.
Add thyme and lemon peel and stir 1 minute.
Add beans, reserved 1/2 cup cooking liquid and 2 tablespoons oil and toss until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat. Cover to keep warm.
Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in another heavy large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle tuna with salt and pepper.
Add tuna to skillet and cook to desired doneness, about 3 minutes per side for medium.
Spoon beans onto center of each of 4 plates, dividing equally among plates. Top each with tuna steak. Spoon Sun-dried Tomato Sauce over tuna steaks and serve immediately.
